channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Active wasps nest on Ha-Ha pathway needs removing., 13th July
item.description:
Dear all, There is a very active wasps nest on The Ha-Ha public footpath that needs removing immediately, before someone else gets stung. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Substantial Fly-tipping, 13th July
item.description:
Deposited opposite Gravel Pit Lane. Please ensure you look through the rubbish to trace perpetrators. Please don't not do this as per last occasion of Fly-tipping at this spot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southend Close, Avery Hill, London

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Bv66 vnh, 13th July
item.description:
The owner of this vehicle likes to clean it with baby wipes and then chuck all the wipes in the road outside the flat where he lives. It is a white Vauxhall Astra. Person fly tipping is a IC3 male around 30 years old. 180cm and medium build. The phrase "Don't crap on your own door step" would require far too much intelligence for some.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swiftsden Way, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The tree at the junction of Larch Way is blocking view of junction., 13th July
item.description:
A low hanging branch is blocking the view of the junction when turning left going from larch way onto Faringdon Avenue. It blows in the wind so can suddenly obscure vision making it dangerous especially as you are trying to turn onto a bus route.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Larch Way, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping and littering, 13th July
item.description:
Flytipping of general rubbish now happening in corner where the cages were because the cages were replaced with a bin, encouraging people to just dump rubbish there. More generally, there is is build up of rubbish up and down Faversham Road once again - mainly on the verges of the road. It requires a thorough deep clean to sort it out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Faversham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sreatley Road Pocket Park. NE corner, 13th July
item.description:
There is an homeless camp in the park. Plenty litter, matrasses and a tent. Human faeces as well.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Streatley Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
